original: Is [Root.GetKingQueen] of Italy or [Root.GetEmperorEmpress] of Italia\n
translation: 是意大利王国的[Root.GetKingQueen]或意大利亚帝国的[Root.GetEmperorEmpress]\n

original: Holds at least one kingdom or empire title within the de jure empires of Francia, Germania, Hispania or Britannia\n
translation: 至少在法兰克帝国、日耳曼尼亚帝国、西班牙帝国或不列颠尼亚帝国法理领土内拥有一个王国或帝国头衔\n

original: No other Christian ruler is Emperor of Italia, Francia, Germania, Hispania or Britannia\n
translation: 没有其他基督教统治者持有意大利亚帝国、法兰克帝国、日耳曼尼亚帝国、西班牙帝国或不列颠尼亚帝国的头衔\n
欢迎来到《王国风云II》的世界

original: \n\nFor your first game we strongly recommend playing a special learning scenario as §YKing Alfonso VI of León§!. When it ends you can keep playing as normal.
translation: \n\n强烈建议新玩家通过§Y莱昂王国的阿方索六世§!教学战役。教程结束后您可以以普通模式继续战役。

original: The main currencies in this game are your Wealth, Prestige and Piety. Wealth is of course the monetary currency (you can call it 'gold' if you like), and increases primarily through taxation. Prestige is a measure of your success and prestige as a ruler, and your Piety shows how respected you are by the clergy. The Prestige and Piety of all your characters will be added to your score, determining your final rank when the game ends.
translation: 游戏中的主要资源是您的财富、威望以及虔诚。财富自然是钱，主要通过税收获得。威望衡量您作为君主的成就和名望，而虔诚代表了宗教阶级对您的态度。所有您扮演过的角色的威望与虔诚将会算入总分，用来决定游戏结束时您的分数等级。

original: During the Learning Scenario, you will get messages like this to help you to figure out what you can do next. You are, however, free to click around and do things on your own. Whenever you run out of things to do, it might be helpful to check out the Alerts that appear at the top of the screen.
translation: 在教学战役中，您会收到类似这枚信息的提示以助于您了解后续如何游玩。您仍可选择自由探索游戏。当您觉得无事可做时，上方的提示有助于您决定如何继续游戏。

original: Depending on what you are currently doing, there are several Map Modes to suit your needs. The default Map Mode is the Terrain Map Mode. Another helpful map mode is the Independent Realms Map Mode, showing the borders of the different Realms in the world. Feel free to check out the different Map Modes in the lower right corner to see what they show.
translation: 根据您的实时操作，游戏里有多个地图模式满足您的需要。默认模式是地形。另一个有用的地图模式是：展现不同独立领土间国界的独立领主模式。请您尝试探索一下右下角的各个地图模式的作用。

original: This is you, up in the left corner. Clicking the Portrait will give you more information about [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and his family. You can also click on the Crest next to the portrait to get information about your Country.\n\nClick the Portrait to find out more about your Ruler and his family. Note that you are currently unmarried and your Heir is your brother, the King of Castille. Should you die at this point, you can keep playing as him since he is of your Dynasty. Yes, that means he would inherit León and be king of two Kingdoms...
translation: 左上角的角色就是您。点击头像可获得更多关于[Root.GetTitledFirstName]和他家人的信息。您也可以点击头像旁的徽记来了解您的国度。\n\n点击头像以查看您的统治者以及他的家人。注意，您现在是单身而继承人是您的弟弟，卡斯蒂利亚国王。如果您现在就去世，则可以扮演身为同一家族的他继续游戏。同时这意味着他会获得莱昂王国，一君治二国……

original: Although you do have a valid Heir of your Dynasty (your brother), having children of your own will ensure that there is a next generation of successors. Besides, your brother might die before you do. As soon as you have a son, he will be your new Heir. To produce legitimate children you need to get married! The Arrange Marriage view, found by clicking on your portrait, is a good tool for finding suitable spouses (it's the button with the two golden rings). You can also use the Character Browser in the bottom right corner of the screen to find more characters.
translation: 虽然您的家族里有合适的继承人（您的兄弟），但是生下您自己的孩子能保障家族有下一代继承人。此外，您的兄弟也许会早于您去世。当您有儿子的时候，他会成为您的新继承人。要诞生合法的子女，您首先需要结婚！请点击您的头像，可以找到安排婚姻界面（两枚金戒指图案的按钮），您可以在这里选择合适的配偶。您也可以用右下角的角色查找器找到更多合适的角色。

original: Help to find good spouses will follow.
translation: 关于如何找到好配后的提示在之后。

original: When looking at potential spouses, there are a few things you should keep in mind: First, your spouse's Attributes will boost your own, so a skilled spouse is preferable. Secondly, marriages are the only way to secure Alliances in the game, so try to marry into the close family of rulers you want to ally. Third, you cannot marry children, but you can betroth them (though that will not yield any Attribute boost.) Right now it would be wise to marry a healthy adult woman of childbearing age.
translation: 当寻找配偶时，有几个要点请您牢记：首先，配偶的属性会提升您自身的属性，所以一个优秀的配偶很重要。第二，联姻是游戏中确保同盟关系的唯一途径，因此请尽量与您想要结盟的统治者的亲近家族联姻。第三，您无法同未成年人结婚，但可以定婚约（虽然这不会带来属性加成。）现在最明智的还是寻找一个健康的、尚在生育年龄的成年女子结婚。

original: Your Realm consists of a number of Counties (the provinces on the map). Each County contains at least one Holding (Castle, City or Temple). By clicking on a County you can see - among other things - its Holdings. The Holdings held by you personally are collectively called your Demesne. Unfortunately, there is a limit to how many Holdings you can control directly. This value is shown in the top bar. If you have more Holdings than your limit, you will start to suffer serious penalties...
translation: 你的国度由许多伯爵领组成（地图上的省份）。每个伯爵领由至少有一个领地（城堡、城市或教堂）。由你本人直接占有的土地叫直辖领地。可惜的是，能拥有的直辖领地有一个上限。这个数值显示在右上角。如果你超出了直辖上限，你会收到严重的惩罚……

original: The Demesne Limit is the reason you need Vassals! You can control more Holdings than your Demesne Limit allows indirectly through your Vassals. Your Vassals will give a part of their troop Levies and Taxes to you. There is a limit to how many Vassals you can have as well, which is why you might want to have fewer - but more powerful - Vassals. Vassals can also have Vassals, and so on. Vassals of the lowest rank (below Count, with a copper portrait frame) are not counted towards the Vassal Limit.
translation: 封臣存在的意义就是解决直辖上限带来的问题！你可以通过封臣控制超出你直辖上限的领土。你的封臣同时会提供一部分税收和兵员给你。这也就是为什么你更加应当拥有少数精悍的封臣。封臣同时也能有封臣，如此下去。最底层的封臣（比伯爵低，角色头像包着一圈铜环）不计入封臣上限。

original: You need to keep your Vassals happy, because their Opinion of you controls how much Tax and Levies they will give you. If they dislike you enough, they might even join rebellious Factions, which can lead to civil wars. Bishops (priestly vassals) who like the Pope more than you will actually send their Taxes to him instead! Opinions are represented by a number ranging from -100 to 100, and you can see exactly why they feel the way they do by hovering over the number.
translation: 你需要保障封臣都很开心，因为他们对你的好感决定了你能获得多少来自封臣的税收和兵员。如果他们太讨厌你了，甚至有可能加入叛军派系，直接引起内战。主教（宗教封臣）们如果对教宗好感高于你，他们会直接把所有税款缴给教宗。好感是从 -100 到 100 的数字，你可以移动鼠标到数值上查看具体为什么有这样的好感值。

original: Oh dear, it seems the ungrateful peasants of Salamanca have revolted against you! To deal with the Revolt, you need to raise your Levies. If you go to the Military View you will see the buttons that allow you to raise your Personal Levies and your Vassal Levies. By holding down Control when you click the button you will avoid raising levies in Counties with enemy troops.
translation: 哦天啊，看来是不知好歹的农民在萨拉曼卡揭竿而起了！你需要拉壮丁来对抗叛军。前往军事窗口，你可以看到一些按钮，通过他们你能够动员你的直辖征召和封臣征召。如果点击这些按钮的同时按住 Ctrl，你可以避免征召敌人所在省份的征召兵。

original: To move your Armies around, simply click on their Shield to select them and then right click on the Province you want them to go to. You can also select several Armies by holding down your left mouse button and dragging the mouse to create a selection box. It is wise to gather your troops together before attacking the enemy.
translation: 让部队移动，只需点击盾徽然后右击目标省份。你可以按住鼠标左键拖拽以选择多个部队。最好还是在对阵前集结你的部队。

original: When you have moved all your Armies to the same Province, select them all (by click-and-drag) and then click the Merge Troops button in the Army window to merge them into a single Army. You can also assign and change the Leaders of your Army by clicking on the name bar above each flank. Leaders can help you win battles, but there is always the risk of them getting injured or even killed.
translation: 当你将所有部队集中到一个省份后，全选他们然后在部队窗口点击合并部队按钮。你可以通过点击每路军队上方的姓名横条任命和更改各自的指挥官。指挥官可以助你赢得胜利，但他们也是冒着受伤甚至死亡的风险在作战。

original: When attacking across a Strait or River, you will get a penalty for that fight. Click on a Province and hover over the River Icon (if any) to see on which border the Rivers and Straits are. Note that if the target Province is under siege, you will need to toggle from Siege View to Province View. Go ahead and crush the peasant rabble!
translation: 当通过海峡或河流进攻时，你的部队将承受一些惩罚。点击一个省份并移动鼠标至河流图标（如果有）上查看哪些省份与河流或海峡相接。注意，如果你要查看的省份正在被围，你需要从攻城界面切换到省份界面。去击败那些乌合之众吧！

original: You dealt with the Revolt nicely! Now that you are at peace, it would be wise to dismiss your Levies. Having raised Personal Levies will cost you money, and Vassals will get angry if you have their Levies raised for too long. You dismiss Levies in the Military tab, the same way they were raised.
translation: 你完美的解决了那些叛军！现在和平降临，你最好解散军队。直辖征召需要花费金钱维持，而如果封臣的军队被征召太久，他们也会不高兴。用征召部队同样的方式，在军事窗口解散他们。

original: Now would be a good time to consider expanding your Realm. The easiest targets for military expansion are small neighboring realms. However, since you need to know about fleet operations, let's pick Canarias, a single County realm just off the coast of West Africa...
translation: 现在是扩张你领土的时机。军事扩张最容易的目标就是周围一圈小国。不过，鉴于你应该要熟悉如何运用舰队，我们选加那利，一个在西非近海的一省小国。

original: In order to go to War in Crusader Kings II, you'll need a Casus Belli - a 'just cause'. A valid Casus Belli could be, for example, pressing a Claim on a Province that is rightfully yours, or waging a Holy War against infidels.
translation: 在《王国风云II》中，宣战需要一个「正义」的宣战理由。宣战理由可以是个人对省份的宣称，或仅仅因为对方信仰不同。

original: Claims can be obtained in several ways: First, you will usually get Claims on any Titles inherited by your siblings when your parents die. Rulers who lose Titles (in a War, for example) will also get Claims on any lost lands. Lastly, of course, Claims can also be fabricated by a crafty ruler... Since Canarias is so distant, you can, unfortunately, not use the Holy War Casus Belli, so you must Fabricate a Claim.
translation: 宣称可以通过数种方式获得：首先，你通常继承你父母或兄弟姐妹死后留下的头衔。因为某些原因（比如战败）失去头衔的君主会获得针对相应领土的宣称。另外，你也可以伪造宣称……鉴于加那利十分遥远，你无法发起圣战，必须要伪造一个头衔。

original: To Fabricate Claims, open your Council View and assign your Chancellor to Fabricate Claims and place him in the County of Canarias. You do this by clicking on the Fabricate Claims button and then on the Province on the map. (You can assign jobs like this to all your Council Members, but they can only do one job at a time.)
translation: 打开你的廷臣界面，选择你的外交官的伪造宣称行动并派遣他到加那利伯爵领去。你可以通过点击伪造宣称再点击目标省份来做到。同样的方式你可以指派其他宫廷官员去做特定的事务，只不过同一时刻他们各自只能做一项工作。

original: If you're fighting an overseas enemy you need to raise your Fleet. In order to do this you open the Military View as you did when raising your Armies, then navigate to the 'Fleet Levies' tab where you find similar buttons to raise your Fleet.\n\nYou should also raise your troops and move them to your coastal County, Asturias de Oviedo.
translation: 如果你与海外的敌人作战，你需要召集舰队。在军事界面里和召集军队一样的方式，在「舰队征召」栏点击对应按钮。\n\n同时你需要调集陆军并移动到你的海岸省份，奥维耶多。

original: When your Fleet has reached its destination, you can disembark your Armies by clicking on the 'Select Troops' button while you have your Fleet targeted. After that you can right click on the Province you wish to move them to. Note that when you disembark your Armies into battle, you will get a penalty for that fight.
translation: 你的舰队到达了目标，你可以通过选择舰队后点击「选择部队」按钮来卸下陆军。之后直接点击目标省份。需要注意的是，登陆作战的军队收到一定作战惩罚。

original: If you want to win a Siege quickly, you can choose to Assault the besieged Holding. There is no guarantee of success, however, and even a successful Assault may come at a high cost to the attacking Army. Castles tend to have stronger Fortification levels than Cities and Church Holdings. Note that if your Army runs out of morale and has no neighbouring Province to retreat to, it will be destroyed.
translation: 如果你想快速攻下城寨，你可以选择强行攻城。强攻没有必胜的保障，即便获胜，攻城方的损失也会是巨大的。城堡通常有比城市和教会更好的防御工事。注意如果一个部队失掉了全部士气又没有临近省份供撤离，就会被直接摧毁。

original: When offering Peace you have three possible options to choose from. You can either Surrender, Offer White Peace or Enforce Demands. Detailed information on each will be shown when hovering over the options. The exact Peace conditions will depend on what Casus Belli was used for the War.
translation: 当和谈时，有三种选择。你可以选择投降，无条件和平或是强行要求对方接受战争条约。每种和谈的细节都能通过移动鼠标到上方获取。和谈的具体条约取决于开战利用的宣战理由。

original: Now that the War is over, you can dismiss your Mercenaries and Levies again. Find a new target for expansion, and consider placing your Chancellor there to Fabricate Claims. You can also use the Holy War Casus Belli against your Muslim neighbours. The latter can be a bit more risky since any ruler of the opposing religion might join your enemy in the War.
translation: 现在战争结束了，你可以解散雇佣兵和征召了。去找个新目标并且让外交官前去伪造宣称。你也可以针对邻近的穆斯林发起圣战。后者因目标附近同宗领主可以加入对你的作战而有些风险。

original: Both your Vassal Limit and your Demesne Size Limit can be increased through the Centralization Law. Low Centralization will give you a bonus to your Vassal Limit, whereas High Centralization will increase your Demesne Size. As you see, you'll have to make a choice here. Demesne Laws such as Centralization can only be changed once every five years. Also, Centralization can only be changed one step at a time.
translation: 你的封臣和直辖上限都可以通过修改集权法增加。权利分散给你更多的封臣上限，而中央集权给你更多的直辖领地。关于这点你得做出权衡。集权法可以5年更改一次，同时一次只能修改一级。

original: The higher levels of the Crown Authority and Centralization laws are restricted by your Technology Level. In order to unlock the more advanced Laws, you must invest in Legalism, found in the Technology View. Legalism is found in the Culture Advances technology tree and costs Cultural Technology Points. The other two technology categories are Military and Economy.
translation: 高等级的王权和集权法需要科技等级十分高。你需要投入法制科技，再能解锁这些高级的法令。在科技窗口下，法制科技在文化科技树下面，花费文化科技点数。其他两类科技是军事和经济。

original: You have been given Technology Points for each of the three types of Advances. Find some Advances that interest you and click the corresponding Invest button to spend Technology Points and increase it to the next level. Technology Points are gained over time, but Technology also eventually advances by itself if neighbouring Provinces are more developed in that particular field.
translation: 你被授予三种科技点数。选几个你有兴趣的进步领域然后点击对应的投资按钮花费科技点数，提高科技等级。科技点数随着时间增长，但如果邻近省份在某个领域更加进步，对应的科技也会慢慢进步。

original: You now have a son and Heir. Your Realm follows the Agnatic-Cognatic Gavelkind Law, which means that daughters inherit only if there are no sons, and all Titles will be distributed among your children upon death. Available Succession Laws and Gender Laws can be seen under the Laws View.
translation: 你现在有个儿子作为继承人了。你的领地使用男性优先均分继承法。也就是说女性只有在没有男性继承人的前提下才可以继承，同时所有头衔都分给子嗣。可用的继承法和性别法在法律界面可以查看。

original: You now have a daughter and Heir. Your Realm follows the Agnatic-Cognatic Gavelkind Law, which means that daughters inherit only if there are no sons, and all Titles will be distributed among your children upon death. You should know that Vassals tend to dislike female Rulers (that's the Middle Ages for you). Available Succession Laws and Gender Laws can be viewed under the Laws View.
translation: 你现在有个女儿作为继承人了。你的领地使用男性优先均分继承法，也就是说女性只有在没有男性继承人的前提下才可以继承，同时所有头衔都分给子嗣。需要知道的是，封臣通常不喜欢女性作为统治者（中世纪嘛）。可用的继承法和性别法在法律界面可以查看。

original: As you might have seen in the Laws View, some Succession Laws require a higher Crown Authority. Crown Authority, which is also found in this view, represents how much legal authority you have over your Vassals. Crown Laws such as this one, indicated by the crown icon next to its name, can only be changed once per ruler. Crown Authority can also only be changed one step at a time.
translation: 你也许在法律界面看到过了，某些继承法需要更高的王权等级。而在同一个窗口中，王权法等级代表着你在法律上对封臣有多少权威。包括王权法在内的这种名字隔壁有王冠的法律，君主一生只能更改一次，而且只能一次提升或降低一级。

original: You now have a son, and following your Agnatic-Cognatic gender laws your first-born daughter is discredited from any inheritance. Instead, your son will inherit your Titles should you die.
translation: 你有了一个儿子，而你第一胎的女儿因为男性优先的性别法彻底失去了继承权。相应的，你的儿子会在你死后继承你的头衔。

original: We mentioned Claims earlier. Your character has Claims on the Kingdoms of Castille and Galicia, as you can see if you click on your portrait. There might be a less risky way to press this Claim than going to War, however.
translation: 我们早先提到过宣称。点击角色头像，你可以看到你的角色对卡斯蒂利亚和加利西亚王国有宣称。然而，通过战争来索取这个宣称不太明智。

original: The King of Castille is actually your brother, and you are currently his Primary Heir. To really make sure that you inherit his Kingdom, you could try to kill him before he can father a son to supplant you as Heir. If you click on your brother's Portrait, you can create a Plot to kill him by clicking on the Plot icon to the left of his Portrait. You can also start Plots from the Plot View. Start a Kill Plot against your dear brother...
translation: 卡斯蒂利亚国王正是你的兄弟。你现在是他的第一继承人。为了确保你能获得他的王国，你可以在他有自己儿子之前杀死他。点击你兄弟头像，你可以点击密谋按钮开始密谋谋杀。你也可以在密谋菜单进行密谋。现在开始谋杀你的亲兄弟……

original: Now you have a Plot going, but you will need the help of others to succeed. You can find Potential Plotters through the Plot View. Not all Potential Plotters might want to join your shady schemes, however. The ones that are hesitant but still close to accepting will usually come to their senses once you bribe them with gifts. To make this simpler, you can also check the 'Auto-invite Plotters' option on the Plot in the Plot View.
translation: 现在你正在酝酿一场密谋，而你需要其他角色来帮助实现。你可以在密谋界面查找潜在的同谋。不是所有潜在同谋都愿意加入你的事业。但是那些犹豫不决的人，可以通过金钱贿赂来保障他们能帮助你。要简化操作，你可以查看阴谋界面中阴谋栏上的「自动邀请参与者」选项。

original: The assassination was successful and your brother is dead... but don't feel too bad about it - after all, this is the Middle Ages! You are now the king of two Kingdoms - León and Castille! You can use the same technique to get your hands on the Kingdom of Galicia as well, reuniting your father's Realm. Yes, in order to do it you will have to kill your other brother before he spawns a son!
translation: 刺杀成功，你的兄弟死了……但是你毫无感觉对吧——这就是中世纪！你现在是莱昂和卡斯蒂利亚两国的共主。你可以用一样的手段去获得加利西亚王国，重新将你父亲的遗产一手掌握。没错，为了达到这个目的，你同样要在你的其他兄弟生下儿子之前杀了他们！

original: Congratulations, another brother lies dead and you have successfully reunited your father's Realm! This concludes the main Learning Scenario, although as long as [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is alive, you might get more messages depending on what happens in the game. You now know everything you need in order to survive and thrive, but there are many more features to discover and master. (Check out the various Tutorial chapters, or simply learn by doing...) Good luck, Kinslayer!
translation: 恭喜，又一个兄弟死了，而你成功地恢复了你父亲王国的统一！主教学关卡就此结束，但只要[Root.GetTitledFirstName]还活着，你就还能接受到关于游戏的合适信息。你现在知道如何生存和扩张，但仍有许多内容需要靠你去发现和掌握。（去尝试其他的教学关卡，或通过实践学习……）祝你好运，弑亲禽兽！

original: Someone in your Realm has started a Faction against you! You can see this Faction, its leader and any other members in the Factions View. Some Faction members might consider leaving a Faction if their opinion of you is increased, but in many cases you might need to get rid of them in some other way.
translation: 国内某些人组成了反对你的派系！你可以在派系界面查看这些派系及其领袖和成员。某些派系成员在对你好感增加后可能会考虑离开派系，但另一些时候你得考虑如何解决掉他们。

original: The Learning Scenario has now ended. Your character died, and if you wish you can now keep playing the game as your Heir, continuing to create the epic story of your Dynasty down through the generations.
translation: 教学战役现在结束了。你的角色已死，你可以选择继续用继承人玩下去，为家族创造辉煌的历史。

original: The Incapable Trait was removed from your character since you are playing the Learning Scenario.
translation: 因为正在教学战役中，无能特质会从您的角色身上除去。

original: Will no longer be known as

With foreign rulers come foreign influences. The local culture in the county of [Root.GetName] has evolved over time into something new, and the people living there are no longer referred to as Picts.
translation: 在外国统治者的影响之下，[Root.GetName]省份已经发展出了全新的本地文化，那儿的人民不再认为自己是皮克特人了。

original: Far from their ancestral Northern lands, the Lombards have over the centuries slowly but steadily adopted more and more Latin and Roman traditions. In the county of [Root.GetName], the people have now gone so far as to start considering themselves properly Italian.
translation: 几个世纪以来，远离着他们祖先所生活的北方之地，伦巴第人缓慢却稳步地吸收着越来越多的拉丁文化和罗马文化的传统。在[Root.GetName]省份，人们甚至开始认同自己为意大利人了。

original: The lowlands near the mouth of the Rhine have long been a crossroads where empires and cultures meet. In the county of [Root.GetName] a new identity now seems to be appearing. They are no longer [Root.Culture.GetName], but Dutch.
translation: 靠近莱茵河口的低地地区长期以来便是帝国和文化交汇的十字路口。[Root.GetName]省份似乎产生了一种新的文化认同。他们不再是[Root.Culture.GetName]人，而是荷兰人了。

original: The traditionally Saxon population of the county of [Root.GetName] has with time and under foreign rule become more and more similar to their Germanic cousins.
translation: 长期以来，[Root.GetName]省份的传统萨克森民众在外国人的统治下与他们的日耳曼表亲愈发相像了。
他们现在是日耳曼人了。

original: The Franks in the county of [Root.GetName] have now adopted enough of Latin customs that they can no longer be recognized as Germanic. The scholars call them 'French'.
translation: [Root.GetName]省份的法兰克人吸纳了许多拉丁习俗，他们不再被认为是日耳曼人了。学者称他们为「法兰西人」。

original: Under Latin influence, the Visigothic population in the county of [Root.GetName] have now adopted new speech and new customs, becoming Occitan in culture.
translation: 在拉丁文化的影响之下，[Root.GetName]省份的西哥特人如今接受了全新的语言和习俗，成为奥克人。

original: The Visigoths in various regions are slowly developing unique local identities with distinctive speech and customs. The latest news is that the county of [Root.GetName] has become Castilian in culture.
translation: 各个地区的西哥特人正在慢慢发展出具有不同方言和习俗的地方特性。[Root.GetName]传来了最新的消息，那儿的人民称自己为卡斯蒂利亚人。

original: The Visigoths in various regions are slowly developing unique local identities with distinctive speech and customs. The latest news is that the county of [Root.GetName] has become Catalan in culture.
translation: 各个区域的西哥特人发展出了具有区域性的方言和习俗的本地身份。[Root.GetName]传来了最新的消息，那儿的人民称自己为加泰罗尼亚人。

original: Through foreign trade and Visigothic influence new traditions are evolving among the Suebi. This is highly noticeable in the county of [Root.GetName], which is now Portuguese in culture.
translation: 在对外贸易以及西哥特文化的影响之下，全新的文化传统在苏维汇人间传播开来。这种情形在[Root.GetName]省份尤为明显，那儿的人民称自己为葡萄牙人。

original: The dynamic society in Muslim Spain is giving rise to a new cultural identity. Thus the people in the county of [Root.GetName] are now calling themselves Andalusian.
translation: 穆斯林西班牙的多元社会正在产生一种全新的文化认同。因此，[Root.GetName]省份的民众开始称自己为安达卢西亚人。

original: Many of the Christian faiths have Patriarchates as well as a religious head. Autocephalous Patriarchs existed as Patriarch rulers for their kingdom, and therefore different realms can have different religious heads even though they share the same religion.
translation: 许多基督教信仰中都同时存在宗教领袖和牧首。自主牧首是各自王国的牧区的领袖。这使得不同的王国在信仰同一宗教的情况下，各自拥有不同的宗教领袖。

original: The Iconoclast faith does not initially have a Patriarch. They can, however, form a Patriarchate if Constantinople is held. Furthermore, Orthodox rulers of the Byzantine Empire can mend the Great Schism between the Orthodox and Catholic churches by controlling all five Pentarchs.
translation: 圣像破坏教会最初不存在牧首。但是教会如果控制了君士坦丁堡，就可以建立起自己的牧区。同时，拜占庭帝国的正教统治者可以控制五大牧区以修复东西教会分裂。

original: Some of the Christian heresies have no religious head. This applies to, for example, the Cathars, Waldensians, Lollards, Bogomilists and Messalians.
translation: 有些基督教异端不存在宗教领袖，如清洁派、瓦勒度派、罗拉德派、波各米勒派和祷告派。

original: Among these religions, the Cathar faith stands out since they even allowed women to be priests. Furhtermore does the Messalian stands out since they did not only allow female priests, but also close kin marriage similar to the Zoroastrians.
translation: 在这些宗教中，清洁派甚至允许女性担任司祭。而祷告派不仅允许女性司祭，还与祆教一样允许近亲婚姻。

original: The Catholic faith is a bit special since the Pope is considered God's representative on Earth. He has more powers than other religious heads, but there is a catch - many Bishops feel more loyal to him than to their secular liege, and will send their taxes to Rome. One way around this problem is to set up an Antipope - a puppet pope who will do what he's told.
translation: 与其他宗教不同的是，天主教信仰认为教宗是上帝在地上的代行人。他比其他宗教领袖宗教的宗教领袖拥有更多的权利。如果一个主教对教宗的忠诚超过对他们世俗领主的忠诚，他们将会把税交到罗马城。解决这个问题的方法之一是设立对立教宗——对领主言听计从的傀儡。

original: Another way of ensuring friendly Bishops is to change the Kingdom law to Crown or Free Investiture Law and nominate loyalists to your bishoprics.
translation: 另一个确保主教对你有好感的方法是降低王权法，或者使用自主神职叙任权来指定忠于你的主教。

original: Zoroastrian rulers can please their vassals with close kin marriage in order to strenghten their dynasties. Zoroastrians are more resilient to becoming inbred, but the risk of this happening does still exist.
translation: 祆教统治者可以通过近亲婚姻来巩固王朝统治并取悦封臣。祆教徒对习惯于近亲结婚并对生出先天缺陷的婴儿更有抗性，但是风险仍旧存在。

original: The High Priesthood of the Zoroastrian faith has ceased to exist, but can be reinstituted if the Persian Empire is once again held by a Zoroastrian ruler.
translation: 祆教大祭司已经消失很久，但只要波斯帝国重新被祆教统治者统治，这一职位就能被再次任命。

original: The Indian religions have no religious heads, and they are all somewhat accepting towards other Indian religions and will find it harder to convert these. They can however subjugate each other, and some of them also allow Holy Wars against non-Indian religions.
translation: 印度宗教没有宗教领袖，他们的教徒或多或少能够接纳其他印度宗教。而且印度宗教互相之间可以征讨，有一些还可以对非印度宗教进行圣战。

original: At game start, the Jewish faith has no religious head. You can, however, change this by restoring the High Priesthood. This can be done by any Jewish ruler who owns the county of Jerusalem.
translation: 游戏开始时，犹太信仰没有宗教领袖。然而你可以通过恢复大祭司来改变这一点。任何犹太教统治者只要拥有省份耶路撒冷即可。

original: The Kingdom of Israel can be restored if the lands belonging to the promised land are controlled by a Jewish ruler.
translation: 如果犹太教领主控制了应许之地，他就能重建以色列王国。

original: The Pagan faiths differs from the other religions in that they start as very decentralized and have no head of religion. Rulers following these unreformed religions are forced to use Gavelkind succession and can not use the Holy War Casus Belli. However, unreformed pagans get a defensive supply limit penalty for religious enemies in their provinces, and a mighty subjugation Casus Belli towards other pagans that they can use once per lifetime.
translation: 原始宗教信仰与其他信仰不同，毫无凝聚力，也不存在宗教领袖。信仰这种未改革宗教的领主们只能使用均分继承法，而且无法发动圣战。不过未经改革的原始宗教徒们在防御外敌时，可以让其他宗教的敌人在他们的省份里受到补给惩罚。另外这些领主一生中还能发动一次征服其他原始宗教徒的战争。

original: Pagan religions can be reformed by controlling at least three holy sites for that religion and having at least 50% Moral Authority, or by holding all five holy sites. The one who reforms a pagan religion in some cases become its new head. Be aware, however, that not all your vassals might agree with the reformation and some might see you as a heretic.
translation: 原始宗教在满足一定条件后可以进行教改。教改可以通过掌握三个宗教圣地并保持至少50%宗教权威，或是直接控制全部五个宗教圣地来进行。某些情况下，改革宗教的领主将会成为宗教领袖。不过要小心，你的封臣并不一定都能接受改革，有些人会将你视作异端。

original: Muslim dynasties risk growing more and more decadent unless their men hold lands or they are victorious in wars. Increases in decadence can be prevented by getting rid of decadent Dynasty members or by simply giving land to them..
translation: 穆斯林家族有可能会越来越腐化。让家族成员持有土地或是打胜仗可以避免这一点。腐化的增长可以通过消除腐化成员，或是封地给他们来防止。

original: Muslim leaders have a powerful invasion Casus Belli that can be used against neighbouring realms if their leaders do not follow the True Faith. Successful invasions will not only grant you the contested provinces, but also any other of the enemy's territories that you occupy.
translation: 穆斯林领主拥有对不信安拉的邻国发动入侵的宣战理由。成功的入侵不仅会给你宣战的省份，还会让你获得你占领的土地。

original: Neither temporary title holders nor their vassals can create any titles
translation: 临时头衔所有者及其封臣不可以创建头衔。

original: Neither temporary title holders nor their vassals can destroy any titles
translation: 临时头衔所有者及其封臣不可以销毁头衔。

original: As your father Pepin died, he divided the Empire of the Franks and left one half to you and the other half to your brother. He divided the lands in such a way as to force you to cooperate - but it does not appear to have had the desired effect. The friction is constant, and at every turn it seems your brother is now trying to thwart your plans and weaken your position. You still rule as joint kings, but surely this peace cannot last...
translation: 在你父亲丕平死时，他将法兰人帝国一分为二交给你和你的弟兄。他分配土地的方案本意是让你们两彼此合作，可现实似乎适得其反。每次冲突时，你的兄弟都想阻挠你的计划并削弱你的地位。你们现在还是共治国王，但这和平的局面无法注定长久……

original: He will not succeed in his vile schemes!
translation: 他卑鄙的图谋不会得逞！

original: With the death of your brother [From.GetFirstName], the prestige and honor of the Frankish kingship falls on you. He was your rival but now he is no more. There is still much to be done, but here begins a new chapter in the story of [Root.GetFirstName], [Root.GetTitle] of the Franks.
translation: 随着你兄弟[From.GetFirstName]的死亡，法兰克领袖的威望和荣耀落到了你的肩上。他曾是你的劲敌，而如今他已不在。未来还有许多等着你去做，但法兰克人的[Root.GetTitle][Root.GetFirstName]的故事已经翻开了新的篇章。
无论如何，他是我的兄弟。

original: §Y$VASSAL$§! is no longer a participant in §YThe $WAR$§! as $PRONOUN$ liege §Y$LIEGE$§! joined the war as §Y$SIDE$§!.
translation: §Y$VASSAL$§!不再是§Y$WAR$§!的参加者，因为$PRONOUN$领主§Y$LIEGE$§!作为§Y$SIDE$§!加入战争。

original: §YThe $WAR$§! has ended as §Y$LIEGE$§! joined the war as §Y$SIDE$§!.
We cannot join our vassals' wars (except for Crusades/Jihads and for supporting their claims outside your realm)
translation: 不能加入封臣的战争（除了十字军或吉哈德）

original: Your mother has come to see you. As she is shown in, she falls to her knees in front of you and says: 'My dearest son. I know my support for your brother in your struggle may have caused you grief. After his death, I have seen how wrong I was to take sides. Please, can you find it in your heart to forgive me and take me into your household, so that I may now repay the injury that I have done to you with new love and loyalty?'
translation: 你的母亲前来看望你。一进来，她便跪在你面前说道：「我最亲爱的儿子，我知道我在你和你兄弟的斗争中对他的支持引起了你的悲痛。在他死后，我已经认识到我是多么偏袒他。你能从心里原谅我并把我带回你的家庭，让我可以用全新的爱与忠诚来抹平我所带给你的伤痕吗？」

original:
My son,
I write to you to ask that you stop causing trouble for your brother and do not interefere with his plans. He loves you and you should support him instead of making things difficult for him. [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] sees all and family should not fight with family.

Your loving mother,
[From.GetFirstName]
translation:
吾儿，
我请求你不要再给你兄弟添麻烦，不要再阻挠他的计划。他爱你，你便不应当对他如此。[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]认为家人不可与家人作对。

爱你的母亲，
[From.GetFirstName]

original: It is clear that she is not on my side.
translation: 很明显她不站在我这边。

original: Your mother has come to see you. She speaks to you of your brother and the rivalry between you: 'My dear Charles, it grieves me so that your brother Carloman will not support you as he should but rather has wicked designs on your domains. Rest assured, however, that I shall do all in my power to help and support you. I have even written to him, asking him to cease his plotting and acknowledge that, though the realm is divided between you, he recognize you as the primary ruler of the Franks. I fear, however, that he will not listen to me.
translation: 你母亲前来看望你。她提及你兄弟间的斗争：「我亲爱的查理，看到卡洛曼不支持你反倒对你处处发难，让我感到心寒。但要放心，我会尽我能帮助你。我会写信给他，恳请他不要再算计你，并要让他承认，即便法兰克人的王国一分为二，你仍然是法兰克人首要的王。但我担心他无意听从我。」

original: I thank you for your support, Mother.

A young nobleman called Roland has approached you, declaring that he wishes to serve you. You have heard his name before, he is known to be a strong warrior and able diplomat, wise beyond his years and especially familiar with the Breton lands to the west. He would surely be a useful addition to your court.
translation: 一个名叫罗兰的年轻贵族前来觐见，声称他愿意服侍你。你对他的名字耳熟，知道他既是强壮的战士也是能干的外交官，拥有着超出年龄的智慧，又对西边的布列塔尼了如指掌。他肯定能成为你麾下的有用之才。

original: I don't need a new knight.
translation: 我有够多的骑士要养了。

original: You have been spending a lot of time talking to [From.GetFullName] recently. He is not only loyal but also wise, amiable and very good company. You find you have many things in common.
translation: 你近来同[From.GetFullName]商谈了许多。他不仅忠诚智慧，还是个和蔼可亲乐于与人来往之人。你与他有许多共同之处。

original: Your loyal knight Roland is truly distinguishing himself on campaign. He never fears to lead from the front in battle, he fires up his soldiers with his personal bravery, and he is always first into the fray and the last to withdraw. Where outriders are needed for dangerous scouting missions he insists on going, often being away for days behind enemy lines. If only all your soldiers were this brave and dedicated.
translation: 你忠诚的骑士罗兰在战役中显得出类拔萃。他首当其冲，从不畏惧，用自己的勇气激励着将士们。他从来都是第一个冲陷敌阵，战到最后才撤出。他坚持担负危险的斥候与护卫工作，有时甚至要深入敌后多天。要是所有的士兵都如同他一样多好。

original: The battle won, Roland led a small group of knights in aggressive pursuit, leaving the rest of the army far behind. Penetrating deep through the enemy formations and causing havoc, they caused much damage. Then no one knows what happened - maybe they went too far, or maybe they were surprised by an unexpected counterattack. None of them returned...
translation: 战斗获胜后，罗兰率领一小股骑士发起了追逐，甩下了大部队。他们深入敌阵，所到之处人头落地。没人知道然后发生了什么，也许他们冲的太远，也许遭遇了意外的反击。总之无人生还……

original: Alas! He was my bravest knight!
translation: 唉，他是我最勇猛的骑士！

original: As your army was retreating, the battle lost, Roland took a small group of knights and rode out to raid the enemy's flank and harass them in order to slow them down so that the rest of your forces could escape. It is said that they fought fiercely and valiantly. However, none of them returned...
translation: 随着战事失利，你的部队开始撤退，罗兰带着一小股骑士前去骚扰敌人侧翼，企图骚扰敌人为你殿后。人说他们勇猛无敌，但却无一人生还……

original: The heathen Saxons living North of the realms of the Franks have for a long time held their own against all foreign conquerors, while defiantly staying true to their old religion and raiding Christian lands with no fear of God. No longer shall it be so - the time has come to bring them both the Sword and the Cross. Mercy is something they will find in the next life, should they accept baptism before they perish.
translation: 居住在法兰克国度北部的异教萨克森人长久以来都排除入侵坚守土地，同时维护着旧宗教并侵袭基督徒的国度，丝毫不畏上帝。这样的状况不会再持续了，是时候用剑给他们带来十字架了。仁慈待遇只属于归附基督教之人。

original: You have captured the great pagan sanctuary at Paderborn, one of the holiest places of Germanic paganism. Here stands the great holy tree of Irminsul, which is said to have an immense importance in the heathen faith of the Saxons. To them, Irminsul represents the 'world tree' and is a focus from which they appear to draw much moral strength and inspiration.
translation: 你征服了日耳曼原始宗教最神圣的圣地，帕德伯恩。对于异教徒无比重要的圣树伊尔明苏尔耸立在此。对他们来说，伊尔明苏尔是「世界树」，从中能获得灵感与力量。

original: Keep it and build a grand Christian church on the site.
translation: 留着吧，顺便在旁边建一所宏伟的基督教堂。

original: As the bitter war in Saxony rages on, the armies of [From.GetTitledName] have captured Paderborn, the site of the great shrine of the holy tree of Irminsul. By order of the conquering [From.GetTitle], the troops burned the holy tree and then proceeded to destroy the entire shrine. This has infuriated people of the Germanic religion everywhere.
translation: 与萨克森的战争还在继续，[From.GetTitledName]的军队占领了帕德伯恩，供奉圣树伊尔明索的神庙的所在地。在[From.GetTitle]的命令之下，军队火烧了圣树，继而摧毁了整个神庙。此举着实激怒了所有日耳曼多神教的人民。

original: Irminsul! We will have our revenge!

During the course of the Saxon War, you have captured a lot of Saxon prisoners. Many of them are of noble birth and also very defiant in their views and attitude to our righteous Christian conquest. They keep to their heathen ways and scorn the name of Christ. Perhaps it is time to teach these stubborn Saxons a lesson through a show of strength. If we should try, condemn and execute these captured heathen leaders, we may strengthen our cause, please God and put fear into the hearts of our enemies.
translation: 在萨克森战争中，你抓获了许多囚徒，包括一些出生贵族，强烈抵抗抵制基督教正义征服的人。他们坚持异教，侮辱基督。是时候让这些顽固的萨克森人明白我们不是好惹的了。我们可以尝试谴责并杀掉这些异教头领。一方面能加强我们的事业，取悦上帝，另一方面能让敌人畏惧我们。

original: I shall be merciful even to these heathens.
translation: 即便是异教徒，我也应当仁慈对待。

original: The Saxons are a people that cling fiercely to their old traditions. After suffering defeats and conquest in spite of tenacious resistance, discontent has continued to simmer in the Pagan Saxon lands. Raids on tax collectors, defiance of church duties, all these things have been annoyances to the new rulers without really presenting any severe danger. Now, however, things seem to have changed. A rebel leader has emerged, uniting the rebellious Saxons and gathering warriors for more concerted attacks. He calls himself Widukind, a name that means 'Child of the Woods', in obvious reference to old Pagan myths and fitting to the hit-and-run tactics used by his forces thus far. The army he is gathering is growing, however...
translation: 萨克森人毫无意义地坚持他们的传统，不满之声在被击败征服的异教萨克森土地上蔓延。攻击税收人员，不履行教会义务，所有这些事情虽都不严重，但仍然引得新统治者不快。然而事情还是有了变化。一个叛军头领站了出来，联合各地萨克森叛军。他称自己是维杜金德，意思是「森林之子」。这不仅仅迎合了异教神话，还与他的战术吻合。每过一天他的部队就壮大一分……

original: My Lord, your old enemy Widukind of the Saxons has sent word. He says he recognizes not only the strength of your arms but also the superiority of the Christian faith. He asks for free passage to come to your court in order to be baptized as a Christian. He says he wishes only peace between you and in return for your generosity he will be forever your loyal servant and stay true to the creed of the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church.
translation: 大人，您的旧敌萨克森的威杜金德发来消息。他不仅承认您兵强马壮，还承认您所信仰的基督教具有优越性。他请求前来您的宫廷以便受洗成为基督徒。他希望和您媾和，为了回报您的慷慨，他将成为您永远忠心的仆人并恪守[Root.Religion.GetName]的信条。

original: I will welcome him and baptize him.
Let's invite him here and then kill him.
I shall not even dignify such a proposal with an answer.

The Avar Khaganate was established in Europe in 567 after the Avars had migrated into the Carpathian basin from the east. They crushed the Gepids and allied with the Lombards to form a strong realm in the area. For long periods they alternated between conflict and truce with the Eastern Roman Empire and had close dealings with the Lombard kings. Now, however, this once proud realm has fallen - the area is no longer ruled by an Avar dynasty and shall once again be known by the ancient name of Pannonia.
translation: 阿瓦尔汗国在公元567年定居在了喀尔巴阡盆地，并在欧陆站稳了脚跟。他们击败了格皮德人，又与伦巴第人联盟，成为了当地一霸。长久以来他们不断与东罗马作战，同时又与伦巴第的国王交好。但现在，他们一度伟大的国度没落了。这片地区不再受阿瓦尔人统治，回归了古代的名字，潘诺尼亚。

original: The ancient Lombard Kingdom was established in Italy after a long history of migration originating in Northern Europe. Along the way, the Lombards themselves have changed, both influencing and becoming influenced by the regions they have settled. Now it has finally come to pass that the Lombard lands in Italy no longer have a Lombard ruler and this effectively spells the end of the name of the Kingdom of the Lombards. We shall henceforth speak of the Kingdom of Italy, but the Lombard heritage shall live on...
translation: 古代的伦巴第人从北境迁徙至意大利，最终建立了伦巴第王国。这一路上，伦巴第人与居住之地互相影响。如今，意大利的伦巴第国土不再受伦巴第人的统治，伦巴第人的王国名存实亡。自然我们将称其意大利王国，然而伦巴第人的遗产也会流传下去……

original: Crusader Kings II spans a period of almost 700 years. Choose where in the timeline you want your game to start.
translation: 《王国风云II》纵跨历史近七百年，选择一个时间点开始游戏。

original: The Early Middle Ages started with the fall of the Western Roman Empire in the early 5th century. The earlier part of this era saw the great Germanic and Slavic migrations across Europe, with peoples such as the Goths and Lombards settling in Southern Europe, the Franks settling in Gaul and Saxons crossing the sea and settling in Britain. The Eastern Roman Empire was violently shaken by the pressure from the Goths and Avars, and fought bitterly with the ancient Persian enemy. The rise of Islam saw the Arabs conquering immense amounts of territory in the Middle East and North Africa, and in India several great dynasties vied for dominance, with the Rashtrakutas rising towards the end of the 8th century. In the steppes, the Khazars grew in power, and in Scandinavia things were about to change in a way that was to affect the entire continent...
translation: 中世纪早期始于五世纪西罗马的毁灭。这一时期早期伴随着日耳曼和斯拉夫民族跨越欧洲的迁徙。这些民族里包括在南欧定居的哥特人和伦巴第人、在高卢定居的法兰克人、渡海占领不列颠的萨克森人。与此同时，东罗马受到哥特人与阿瓦尔人的威胁，又与古老的波斯敌人苦战。伊斯兰教的崛起让阿拉伯人横扫中东与北非、征服大量的土地。而在东方的印度，数个大王朝为了曲女城的支配权展开了激烈的竞争，其中包括八世纪末崛起的罗湿陀罗拘陀。而在草原上，可萨人崭露头角；在斯堪的纳维亚，一股搅动世界的力量还未成熟……

original: By the middle of the 9th century, the Norse raiders and adventurers known as the Vikings had already begun to set their indelible mark on the map of Europe, establishing realms in Russia and the British Isles and travelling and raiding as far as the Black Sea and the Mediterranean. The Karling rulers, descendants of Charlemagne, ruled mighty realms in France, Germany and Italy, while the Muslim religion was now firmly established in Spain under the Umayyads. The Byzantine emperor held on, though suffering under increasing pressure from the Caliphate and the Bulgarians. West of the fractured Steppes, The Magyars were poised to make their claim on the Carpathian basin. Islam was spreading rapidly in Persia under rulers such as the Saffarids, and had penetrated into the Indus valley. Further East, the Hindu Pratihara dynasty was expanding.
translation: 九世纪中叶，一群来自北境、被称作维京人的掠夺者和冒险者在欧洲版图上留下了不可磨灭的痕迹。他们在俄罗斯、不列颠群岛建立国家，烧杀抢掠的足迹远及黑海和地中海。查理曼的后人、加洛林王朝的统治者们在法兰西、德意志和意大利统治着强大的国度，与此同时，在伍麦叶王朝统治下，穆斯林的信仰深深地扎根在西班牙的土地上。拜占庭的皇帝在哈里发与保加利亚人的双重压力下坚守着。群雄逐鹿的大草原西部，马扎尔人为了争夺喀尔巴阡盆地而蓄势待发。伊斯兰教在萨法尔王朝等君主的统治下迅速传遍了波斯，并逐渐渗透进印度河谷。再往东，印度教的瞿折罗·波罗提诃罗王朝在不断扩张。

original: By the late 10th and early 11th centuries the Muslim world was changing, with Turkish dynasties such as the Seljuks and Ghaznavids now dominating Persia. The Byzantine Empire was still holding its own but was to see worse times coming. Central and Western continental Europe was split between France and a strong Holy Roman Empire, while Christian kings were advancing against a fractured and weakened Muslim Spain. Scandinavia was quickly converting to Christianity, and the Norse settlers in Russia and Britain had become assimilated with the local populations. Yet Viking descendants in Normandy and Italy were preparing new conquests, and the time of the First Crusade was approaching...
translation: 十世纪末至十一世纪初，穆斯林世界经历着巨大变动——塞尔柱、伽色尼等突厥王朝控制着波斯。拜占庭帝国仍然坚守着国土，但可以预料到更糟糕的情况正在到来。中欧和西欧被法兰西和强盛的神圣罗马帝国所瓜分，与此同时，基督教诸王正着手向分崩离析而虚弱的西班牙穆斯林发起进攻。斯堪的纳维亚迅速地皈依了基督教，而在俄罗斯和不列颠定居的诺斯人也逐渐与当地居民同化。然而，在诺曼底和西西里的维京人后裔仍在准备着新的征服，第一次十字军远征也即将到来……

original: As Europe entered the 13th century, Constantinople had been weakened by the Turks and sacked by the Fourth Crusade, so the Byzantine Empire was very much weakened. The Turks still reigned in the Middle East and Persia, in India many new kingdoms vied for power after the fall of the old dynasties. The Norman conquest had brought new political and dynastic struggles to England and France, the Christian kingdoms in Spain were continually growing stronger, Scandinavia had left paganism behind and was becoming more centralized. In Russia several principalities struggled for power in the shadow of the Bolghars and Cumans to the east. In Germany and Italy, the Holy Roman Empire still stood firm, but beyond all this, to the east, a new power was to come into play. When the Mongols broke into Eastern Europe and Persia, it changed the balance of power in all of Western Eurasia...
translation: 当欧洲进入十三世纪，君士坦丁堡已被突厥人削弱，又经历了第四次十字军的血洗，拜占庭已是强弩之末。突厥人仍然统治着中东和波斯；而在印度，随着旧王朝的衰落，许多新的王国崛起并激烈地争夺权力。诺曼征服为英格兰和法兰西带来了新的政治与王室冲突；西班牙的基督教国家继续成长；斯堪的纳维亚彻底摒弃了原始宗教，中央集权不断加强。在俄罗斯，几个大公国在东边的保加尔人与库曼人的威胁下争权夺利。在德意志和意大利，神圣罗马帝国仍然稳若泰山。但在这一切之外，一股新的力量在东方正准备登场——当蒙古人策马扬鞭进入东欧和波斯，他们将颠覆整个欧亚大陆西部的力量平衡……

original: Europe in the Late Middle Ages was a very different place compared to a few hundred years earlier. Spain was dominated by the Christian kingdoms, the Muslim rulers only clinging on in the south. The Holy Roman Empire still dominated Central Europe next to a strong Hungary, while in France and England dynastic conflicts with roots in the Norman conquest were to lead to long and bloody wars. The Golden Horde and the Ilkhanate dominated the Steppes and Persia, forcing every ruler between Central Europe and India to take the Mongols into account. The Tughluq dynasty ruled an immense empire in India, while North Africa was divided between various Arab dynasties. Turkish domination in the Middle East seemed to have been ended by the Mongol conquests, but in Anatolia a dynasty known as the Ottomans was stirring...
translation: 中世纪晚期的欧洲同几百年前相比大不相同。西班牙由基督教诸王国所统治，穆斯林仅能在最南端的一小片土地上负隅顽抗。神圣罗马帝国仍然控制着中欧，但紧邻着一个强大的匈牙利；与此同时，从诺曼征服起就已埋下祸根的英法王朝纷争将带来更加血腥和旷日持久的战争。金帐汗国和伊儿汗国统治着大草原和波斯，使得从印度到中欧的所有君主都不得不重视蒙古人。图格鲁克王朝在印度拥有广袤的领土，与此同时北非则被众多阿拉伯王朝所分割。突厥人对中东的主导似乎止于蒙古人的入侵，但在安纳托利亚，一个叫奥斯曼的王朝才刚开始崭露头角……

original: Son of Pepin the Short and a descendant of Charles Martel, Charlemagne (or Karl, as his contemporaries called him) became joint king of the Franks with his brother Karloman in 769. After a two-year power struggle, Karloman suddenly and conveniently fell ill and died, leaving Karl as sole ruler of the Franks.  He then proceeded to make the kingdom greater than ever before, conquering Saxony, Lombardy and other lands with equal measures of good strategic planning and ruthlessness. He was eventually crowned Holy Roman Emperor by pope Leo III, and his descendants were to rule large parts of Europe for a long time to come.
translation: 在公元769年，查理马特的后代、矮子丕平之子查理曼（或其同时代人所称的「卡尔」）与他的胞弟卡洛曼成为了法兰克人的共主。经过两年的权力斗争，卡洛曼突然染病暴毙，卡尔成了法兰克人的唯一君主。他旋即大举扩张其王国，用绝佳的战略和与此等量齐观的残酷相继征服了萨克森、伦巴第和其他土地。他最终被教宗利奥三世加冕为神圣罗马帝国的皇帝，而其后代在未来很长一段时间里将一直统治着大半的欧洲。

original: Karloman became joint king of the Franks together with his brother Karl in 768. The two brothers were not friends, rather a rivalry ensued. Karloman was outmaneuvered by his brother's alliance with the Lombards, and sought the support of the Pope in order to counter this, but did ultimately not succeed. He died unexpectedly in 771, just as war for the Frankish crown seemed inevitable. It has been claimed that he was poisoned, but this was never proven...
translation: 卡洛曼在768年与他的兄长一同成为法兰克人的共主。两兄弟并非好友，相反是大冤家。卡洛曼被卡尔与其同盟伦巴第所夹击，便试图获取教宗的支持，但最终并没有成功。当夺取法兰克王冠的战争看似不可避免时，他于771年出乎意料地暴毙。有人说他是被毒死的，但真相无人知晓……

original: Abd-al-Rahman I was born near Damascus in Syria, but had to flee his homeland when the Abbasids took power. He spent several years in exile before arriving in Spain, where he managed to seize power and declare himself ruler of Al-Andalus. He wanted to return east and avenge himself on the Abbasids, but the need to deal with issues closer to home kept preventing him from doing so. He instead set his mark on the history of Spain, establishing the rule of his dynasty there for centuries to come.
translation: 阿卜杜勒·拉赫曼一世出生在叙利亚的大马士革附近，但当阿拔斯崛起后不得不逃离家乡。数年间他流亡各地，最终来到西班牙，在那里他成功夺取权力，并且宣布自己成为安达卢西亚的统治者。他渴望能回到东方、向阿拔斯复仇，但手头的事情一直使他无法遂愿。相反，他的王朝在未来数个世纪中统治着西班牙，成为西班牙历史不可磨灭的一部分。

original: Desiderius became King of the Lombards in 756 after putting down the revolt of his rival Ratchis. Throughout his reign, he was constantly in competition with the popes and the southern dukes for domination of Italy. He sought an alliance with Charlemagne but when the latter divorced his daughter relations were soured. Eventually the kingdom was invaded and conquered by the Franks, making Desiderius the last Lombard king.
translation: 在756年，德西德里乌斯在剿灭其对手拉特奇斯的叛乱后成为了伦巴第国王。在他统治期间，他一直与教宗和南部意大利各大公爵竞争在意大利的霸权。他与查理曼结盟，但后者与他的女儿最终离婚，两国分道扬镳。最终王国还是被法兰克人征服，而德西德里乌斯成了伦巴第人最后的国王。

original: Al-Mansur became sole ruler of the Caliphate after the death of his brother. After defeating several potential challengers to his rule, he led a long and relatively stable reign over his huge empire. His time in power saw the rise of new Islamic literature and scholarship, thanks to cultural tolerance, conversion of new peoples and groups to Islam and a further inclusion of the Persian world into the Caliphate. His reign also saw tentative diplomatic contacts with realms as far away as China.
translation: 曼苏尔在他兄弟死后成了阿拉伯帝国唯一的统治者。在击败数个挑战其统治的潜在对手后，他庞大的帝国迎来了一个相对稳定的长久时期。他的时代见证了伊斯兰文学和学术的发展，这得益与文化的通融与宗教传播，以及将波斯世界纳入到阿拉伯帝国。在其统治下，穆斯林也与远如中国的国度进行试探性的外交活动。

original: Krishna I of the Rashtrakuta dynasty took power in 756, defeating several competitors for the throne in order to secure his realm. He fought wars against the Chalukyas and Pratiharas and conquered Karnataka, making his dynasty more powerful than ever before. He was also a great patron to builders and commissioned many new temples and monuments.
translation: 罗湿陀罗拘陀的奎师那一世在756年击败数个觊觎王座的竞争者后坐稳了江山。他与遮娄其王朝和波罗提诃罗王朝作战，征服了羯罗拏磔迦，进一步加强了他的王朝。他同时又是建筑的支持者，下令建造了许多庙宇和纪念建筑。

original: Halfdan Whiteshirt was born the son of legendary Viking Ragnar Lodbrok. He made several successful expeditions, journeying primarily to England, and later was one of the leaders of the Great Heathen Army of 865. Halfdan managed to build a large realm for himself in England, including areas as far south as London, but later ran into trouble with his peers and was expelled from the realm. He then sought out new adventures and eventually died as a Viking on another bold expedition.
translation: 「白衫」哈夫丹是传说中的维京人朗纳尔·洛德布罗克的儿子。他领导了数次针对英格兰的成功远征，而后来也成为了865年「异教徒大军」的首领之一。哈夫丹成功地在英格兰建立了一个大国，南及伦敦。但后来他与贵族交恶，最终遭到驱逐。随后他一直寻求新的冒险，最终作为一个维京人死在一次大胆的远征中。

original: Rurik was a viking of Swedish origin who took advantage of the internal struggles of the tribes around Ladoga to conquer and establish a strong Norse realm in the east. His successors expanded their influence and eventually ruled as far south as Kiev, and the dynasty soon also adopted the Slavic language and customs (as Viking settlers often did). The descendants of Rurik would eventually become the first Tsars of Russia.
translation: 留里克是来自瑞典的维京人。他借着拉多加附近部落内部的混乱成功在东方建立了一个强大的诺斯人国家。他的继任者进一步扩张他们的影响力，以至于他们统治地域远及基辅。这个家族随后接纳了斯拉夫人的语言和风俗（正如许多诺斯移民一样）。留里克的后人最终成为了俄罗斯的第一任沙皇。

original: When Louis the Pious died, civil war broke out in the Carolingian Empire between his sons due to disagreements over the inheritance. In the settlement that followed the war, Charles was given West Francia. Once Lothair died, however, the balance of power was broken and Charles fought long and bitterly with his brother Ludwig over primacy and over the lands that Lothar had left behind. After Ludwig's death, Charles tried to make a grab for the German lands, but he died during the resulting war in 877 while crossing the Alps.
translation: 当「虔诚者」路易一死，加洛林帝国就在他的儿子们手中因继承问题陷入了内战。战后，查理按照和约分得了西法兰克。然而，当洛塔尔死后，查理和其兄弟路易之间的力量平衡被破坏了，他们长时间地为洛塔尔留下的权力和土地斗争。而当路易死后，查理更尝试夺取德意志的领土，却最终在887年的战争中，穿越阿尔卑斯山时去世。

original: After making peace with his brothers at the Treaty of Verdun, Ludwig ruled over East Francia and Bavaria, lands that he had already administrated before his father's death. After this, he was locked in constant struggles to expand his power in the Frankish Empire, sometimes allying with his brother Charles the Bald and sometimes fighting him. He was also engaged with suppressing rebellions in Saxony and fighting wars on the Moravian border. He was a great sponsor of the church, using it as a means to suppress pagan subjects, and Germany started to develop its own identity as a kingdom during his reign.
translation: 路德维希和他的兄弟签订了凡尔登条约后统治了东法兰克和巴伐利亚。在他父亲死前他就统治着这些国度。在这之后，他一直努力在法兰克帝国内扩张他的权力，时而和他的兄弟「秃头」查理结盟，时而和他作对。他参与镇压萨克森内的叛乱，又在边境与摩尔多瓦人作战。他是教会的伟大支持者，尽其所能压制信仰原始宗教的臣民。而德意志在他的统治下也开始发展出作为一个王国的身份认同。

original: Basil the Macedonian was born to simple peasant parents in Macedonia. After a tumultuous early life, he eventually entered the service of relatives of the imperial house. With time, he became a friend and confidant of Emperor Michael. Using his position to advance his interests, he soon became co-emperor and eventually murdered Michael to become sole emperor. Once in power, he developed a reputation for efficiency and dedication to the empire. He restored good relations with the Pope and strengthened the eastern frontier in spite of hard-fought wars with the Paulicians and the Arabs.
translation: 「马其顿人」巴西尔作为一个普通农户的儿子在马其顿出生。度过不安定的早年，他最后进入了为皇室成员服务的部门中任职。时间一长，他成了皇帝米海尔的忠实好友。利用其特殊地位。他不久就成为了共治皇帝，随后谋杀了米海尔，从而成为帝国唯一的皇帝。取得权力后，因其对帝国管理的效率和贡献，他获得了良好的声誉。他重新恢复了与教宗的良好关系，在与保禄派异端和阿拉伯人鏖战之余，还加强了东部的边防。

original: Al-Mu'tazz became Caliph in 866, at only 19 years of age, in a situation where the Abbasid Empire was rife with power struggles between different factions. After a very bloody period of dealing with his various enemies he looked like he was coming out on top, but by then his coffers were empty and a rebellion among the soldiers turned his fortunes around. In the end he was taken prisoner, beaten and locked in a room to starve to death. He was 24 years old when he died.
translation: 穆塔兹年仅19岁便在866年成为哈里发。当时的阿拔斯帝国权力混乱，派系纷争不断。在经历了与他敌人的血腥对抗后，他似乎就要成功了。但那时他的国库已空，士兵叛乱让其命运彻底改变。最终他被俘虏，在遭到殴打后被关在房间里饿死，年仅24岁。

original: William the Conqueror, a descendant of the Viking chief Rollo, became duke of Normandy at a very young age, a situation compounded by the fact that he was also a bastard. Early on he was constantly being used as a pawn by rival factions in the duchy, with a succession of his guardians being murdered. Once he reached adulthood, he faced years of warfare in order to take full control over his duchy, eventually emerging victorious. In 1066 he successfully invaded England to press a claim on the English throne. He spent the remainder of his reign consolidating and reforming his new kingdom in the face of sometimes fierce opposition.
translation: 「征服者」威廉，维京首领罗洛的后代，在年轻——并且还是个私生子——时就成为了诺曼底公爵，最初他一直被公国内互相对立的派系当作棋子利用，他的许多监护人都因此而遭到谋杀。当他成年时，他被迫征战多年以取得对公国的完全控制、1066年，他成功入侵英格兰，获得了英格兰王位。他利用其余下的统治时间去巩固和改革他的新王国，有时甚至要面对激烈的反对。

original: Robert Guiscard was the sixth son of Tancred de Hauteville, a petty Norman lord. Just like his brothers, he left Normandy with a small force of followers to seek his fortune in Italy. A brilliant and ruthless leader, he spent several years building a reputation as a mercenary, and the ever changing political landscape in Italy eventually saw the pope investing him as Duke of Apulia. In further campaigns, he proceeded to conquer Sicily, fighting both the Saracens and the Byzantines to secure control. He thus established Norman rule in southern Italy and his conquests had a profound long term impact on the region.
translation: 罗贝尔·吉斯卡尔是一个小诺曼领主坦克雷德·德·欧特维尔的第六子。如同他的兄弟，他带着少许士兵离开诺曼底前去意大利追求未来。作为一个冷酷又天才的领袖，他花费多年时间成为有名的佣兵。而变幻多端的意大利政局，使得教总任命他为阿普利亚公爵。接下来他通过作战占领了西西里，与萨拉森人和拜占庭人作战以取得控制。于是，他便在南意大利建立了诺曼人的统治，而他的征服对当地影响深远。

original: Béla IV came from the long lineage of the Árpád rulers of Hungary. He refused to swear fealty to the Mongol Khan Ögödei and thus was faced with a Mongol invasion of Hungary. All seemed lost but salvation came with the death of Ögödei in 1242 since Batu of the Golden Horde ordered the army to safeguard the election of a new Great Khan back in Asia. Béla spent the following years building his kingdom in preparation for another Mongol invasion and became known as the Second Founder of the State.
translation: 贝拉四世来自统治匈牙利的阿帕德家族的悠长血脉。他拒绝向蒙古的窝阔台汗臣服，因此面临蒙古人大举入侵匈牙利的困境。在绝望之际他得到了拯救——窝阔台在1242年过世，而金帐汗国的拔都决定让军队撤回亚洲守卫新可汗的选举。在之后的岁月里，贝拉不断地坚实其王国，为下一次蒙古入侵作准备，他被认为是这个国家的第二奠基人。

original: Hulegu was the grandson of Genghis Khan. When his brother Möngke became Great Khan, Hulegu was ordered to conquer the remaining Muslim territories in western Asia. For his campaign he was assigned the largest Mongol army assembled and with it he ravaged the important Muslim cities of Baghdad and Damascus. This effectively pushed the centre of Muslim power west to the Mamluks in Cairo. He was also responsible for destroying the Hashashins. The lands he conquered became the foundation for the Ilkhanate which became a major power in the Middle East.
translation: 旭烈兀是成吉思汗的孙子。当他的兄长蒙哥成为可汗，旭烈兀受命去征服西亚剩下的穆斯林领土。为了这次战役，蒙古最大的集结部队委派给了他，而他以此则重创了穆斯林的世界重镇巴格达和大马士革。这直接导致穆斯林的中心西移至马穆鲁克的开罗。他同时也摧毁了阿萨辛。被征服的土地成为了中东大国——伊儿汗国——的基础。

original: Casimir the Great inherited the throne of Poland in 1333 and continued his fathers work in unifying the Polish kingdom. During his lifetime he went on military campaigns to expand his realm to the east and solidify his borders in the west. To get support from the Hungarian nobles he also promised them the Polish throne if he would end up heirless. Unfortunately he didn't manage to produce a legal male heir, in spite of his four different marriages, and after his death in 1370 the Hungarians pressed their claim to the Polish crown and ended the Piast dynasty.
translation: 「伟大者」卡齐米日三世在1333年继承了波兰王位并继承了其父亲统一波兰王国的事业。在其一生中，波兰通过军事往东部扩张，稳固了西部的边境。为了取得匈牙利贵族的支持，他提出如果自己无子，便让匈牙利人来继承王位。可惜的是即便经过了四次婚姻，他依然没有生下合法的男性继承人。在他死后，匈牙利人于1370年宣称索要波兰王位，结束了皮雅斯特王朝。

original: My Lord, there is a visitor at the gate, a Norseman calling himself Ogier. He looks strong and rugged but also speaks with grace and has a noble bearing. He says he comes from the land of the Danes and has travelled far to offer his services to you, naming you rightful lord of all Christians. He also claims to have seen in a dream how you will conquer all and your name will rise in glory to the Heavens.
translation: 陛下，有个诺斯人前来觐见。他自称奥吉尔，看起来强壮勇猛，但话语间流露贵族之风。他说他来自丹麦人的土地，跋山涉水前来服侍您，认定您是所有基督徒的合法领主。他同时声称在梦里见到了您征服天下，最终在荣耀中升入天堂。

original: Welcome this bringer of good prophecies!
translation: 欢迎带来神之启示之人！

original: We don't need his kind here.

My [Root.GetLordLady], there is a noble warrior at the gate. He says he is a veteran of many battles and desires to become a champion of your house. He praises your wisdom and honor and pledges to always defend you and your household if you will accept him in your retinue.
translation: [Root.GetLordLady]，有一个贵族战士前来觐见。他说他是久经沙场的老兵，希望能成为您麾下的勇士。他赞美了您的智慧和荣耀，并且决定只要您接纳他，便始终守护您和您的家族。

original: You are riding through your domains in the company of your household guard, when you come upon a bridge crossing a rapid river. On the bridge stands a dark-clad warrior in heavy armor with his sword drawn. When challenged, he refuses to get out of the way, speaking only the words: 'None shall pass'.
translation: 你在家族守卫的陪伴下巡回你的国度.当你渡桥穿越激流时，一个身着黑色盔甲的勇士提剑站在桥上。即便被挑战，他也拒绝挪开一步，只是说道：「禁止通行。」

original: What a strange man. I will kill him myself.
translation: 奇怪的男人，我亲自出手杀他。

original: With the ambition to become [GetKingQueen] of §Y[Capital.Kingdom.GetName]§!, §Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! is not allowed to move the capital outside the de jure kingdom.
translation: 由于选择了成为§Y[Capital.Kingdom.GetName]§![GetKingQueen]的野心，§Y[GetTitledFirstName]§!不允许将首都迁至法理王国之外。

original: This is where the adult men of the city muster to join the militia in times of war.
translation: 城中的成年男性在战时于此集结为民兵。

original: Training grounds is where the castle levies can practise and ready themselves for the inevitability of war.
translation: 训练场为征召兵提供军事训练。

original: Zun, the Giver of Justice, is the sun-god originally worshipped by the Zunbil dynasty in Afghanistan. Zun embodies wisdom, power, fire and the light that drives away the night. Defining features in-game:\n§Y*§! Can declare Subjugation Wars against all other pagans\n§Y*§! Inferior at conversion and vulnerable to non-pagan missionaries
translation: 正义使者尊日神，是最初由阿富汗的樽比勒王朝崇拜的太阳神。祂是智慧，力量，火焰和光明的化身。在游戏里的特征定义为：\n§Y*§! 可以对其他原始宗教发动入侵战争\n§Y*§! 传教效率低下且易受非原始宗教影响

original: The [suebi.GetName] warrior tradition is held in high regard by every free man. Groups of highly mobile infantry armed with longspear, shield and axe train here in order to better defend their community in times of danger.
translation: 在[suebi.GetName]的自由人中，勇士传统自古有着崇高的意义。这些快速灵活的勇士在这里学习如何运用长矛，盾和斧，以备战事。

original: This building has cost $AMOUNT$ Prestige and has a buildtime of $TIME$ Months.
translation: 这个建筑花费 $AMOUNT$ 威望并且需要 $TIME$ 月完成建造。

original: You have §R$NUM$§!/§Y$MAX$§! vassals, giving you less taxes and levies from your vassals. You risk losing vassals if your character dies.
translation: 你有 §R$NUM$§!/§Y$MAX$§! 封臣，这使你的封臣提供更少的税收和征召兵。如果你的角色死了，你可能会失去封臣。

translation: 帮助你的领主管理管理他最近取得的头衔，并把这些头衔封给国内其他人。

original: Liege has not been recently proposed to be helped.\n
translation: 领主近期没有被提出此类帮助。\n

translation: 领主未曾拒绝此类帮助。\n

original: Yes I would appreciate some help!
Stop bothering me about this nonsense!
None of your council members will bother you about this matter in the near future.
translation: 你的内阁成员们不会再找你商讨此事了。

original: This is the Chronicle of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], in which is contained the record of its yearly fortunes, glories and difficulties.
translation: [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]家族的编年史，记录其幸运、荣光与艰难。

original: A dragon was seen in the county of [Root.GetName].
translation: 在[Root.GetName]省份，有一条龙被目击。

original: A giant destroyed several villages in [Root.GetName], but then disappeared without trace.
translation: 一个巨人在[Root.GetName]毁了好几个村子，之后却消失的无影无踪。

original: Strange and wonderful serpents were seen in [Root.GetName].
translation: 有人传说在[Root.GetName]见到了神奇的大蛇。

original: Several people in [Root.Capital.GetName] spoke of seeing strange shapes dancing on the moon.
translation: 好几个在[Root.Capital.GetName]的人说看到月亮上有奇怪的影子起舞。

original: A ten feet tall woman was crucified in the county of [Root.GetName].
translation: 在[Root.GetName]省份，一个十英尺的女人被钉死在十字架上。

original: Villagers saw blood raining from the sky in the county of [Root.GetName].
translation: 在[Root.GetName]省份，村民们见到血从天降下。

original: A strange plague killed thousands of wild rabbits in the county of [Root.GetName].
translation: 在[Root.GetName]省份，一股奇怪的瘟疫导致了上千野兔的死亡。

original: The earth shook for three days in [Root.GetName], killing two hundred peasants and a priest.
translation: [Root.GetName]发生了一场持续三天的地震，致使两百名农民和教士死亡。

original: A river flooded parts of [Root.GetName] in the spring.
translation: 春季，[Root.GetName]江洪爆发，波及面甚广。

original: [Prev.PrimaryTitle.GetName] was attacked by the [From.Culture.GetName] realm of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], ruled by [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick].
translation: [Prev.PrimaryTitle.GetName]被[From.Culture.GetName]国家[From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]进攻，进攻方的统治者为[From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick]。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName], wherein all faithful [Root.Religion.GetName]s were called to help conquer [From.GetName] from the [New.Religion.GetName]s.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]发起了一次[Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName]，其中所有虔诚的[Root.Religion.GetName]们受到感召而前来将[From.GetName]从[New.Religion.GetName]掌控下征服。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName], wherein all unfaithful [Root.Religion.GetName]s were called to conquer [From.GetName] from the [New.Religion.GetName]s.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]发起了一次[Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName]，一众亵渎神灵的[Root.Religion.GetName]受到络绎不绝的号召，前去从[New.Religion.GetName]的手中征服[From.GetName]。

original: The [From.Religion.GetCrusadeName] declared by [From.RelHead.GetDynName] ended with the successful conquest of [Root.GetName] from the [New.Religion.GetName]s.
translation: [From.RelHead.GetDynName]发动的[From.Religion.GetCrusadeName]结束。成功地从[New.Religion.GetName]手中占领了[Root.GetName]。

original: The [From.Religion.GetCrusadeName] declared by [From.RelHead.GetDynName] ended with the successful conquest of [Root.GetName] from the [New.Religion.GetName]s. [From.GetDynName] became the new [From.GetLordLady] of the conquered lands.
translation: 发动的[From.Religion.GetCrusadeName]由[From.RelHead.GetDynName]领导的战争已结束。成功地从[New.Religion.GetName]的手中占领[Root.GetName]。[From.GetDynName]从而成为占领地的新[From.GetLordLady]。

original: The [From.Religion.GetCrusadeName] declared by [From.GetDynName] ended in defeat as the armies failed to conquer [Root.GetName].
translation: [From.GetDynName]发动的[From.Religion.GetCrusadeName]以失败告终。占领[Root.GetName]的目标，终是痴人说梦。

original: Strange rumors reached the [Player.Culture.GetName] lands, speaking of strong armies gathering in the Eastern steppes under the Great Khan, with men too numerous to count.
translation: 在[Player.Culture.GetName]的地方上传来奇怪而陌生的传闻。传闻道：东方的草原上，可汗集结了强大而为数众多的军队，向着西方奔袭而来。

original: Strangers in strange ships landed in the [FromFromFrom.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] county of [FromFromFrom.GetName], bringing rise to much worry and rumours across the lands.
translation: 奇怪船只上的陌生人在[FromFromFrom.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective]的省份[FromFromFrom.GetName]登陆，引起整个地区的不安和流言。

original: A terrible scourge was unleashed upon [FromFromFrom.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as the hordes of the Aztec Emperor arrived from beyond the sea to wreak havoc and destruction.
translation: 阿兹台克皇帝带领着部众与军队跨海而来，他们犹如一场可怕的灾难席卷[FromFromFrom.Holder.PrimaryTitle.GetName]，除了杀戮与破坏，别无所予。

original: [Root.GetDynName] created the title of [From.GetFullName], confirming [Root.GetHerHis] growing power with much ceremony and celebration.
translation: [Root.GetDynName]正式创建头衔[From.GetFullName]，并通过一系列仪式和庆典以确认[Root.GetHerHis]权势不断地成长。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone in honor of [Root.GetHerHis] father, [Root.Father.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick].
[Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone in honor of [Root.GetHerHis] mother, [Root.Mother.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick].
[Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone in memory of [Root.GetHerselfHimself].
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上记下了[Root.GetHerselfHimself]记忆中的荣光时刻。

original: [Root.GetTitledNameWithNick] raised a runestone in memory of [Root.GetHerHis] extraordinary exploits in a flying longship.
translation: [Root.GetTitledNameWithNick]在符石上记下了[Root.GetHerHis]记忆中曾经在龙头长船上探险过的种种。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone celebrating [Root.GetHerHis] love for mead.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上记下了[Root.GetHerHis]爱好是蜂蜜酒。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone celebrating [Root.GetHerHis] great wisdom.
[Root.GetTitledName] managed to raise a runestone in spite of the things men said about [Root.GetHerHis] intellect.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]设立了符石，尽管众人曾谈及有关[Root.GetHerHis]才能。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone celebrating [Root.GetHerHis] great strength.
[Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone celebrating [Root.GetHerHis] great knowledge of the world and everything in it.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上颂扬对世界万物[Root.GetHerHis]全智全能。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone warning the world of the horrors awaiting any who would defy [Root.GetHerHis].
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上警告说若谁蔑视于[Root.GetHerHis]，他将给予他世界级的恐惧。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone with poetic words carved into it.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上用诗的语言留下了印记。

original: [Root.GetTitledName] raised a runestone honoring Christ and Saint Michael.
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上记下了他对耶稣基督以及圣米迦勒的无限敬意。

translation: [Root.GetTitledName]在符石上自夸如何对[Root.GetHerHis]敌人施以凶暴。

[Root.GetTitledName] adopted new customs to embrace [Root.Culture.GetName] culture, no longer considering [Root.GetHerselfHimself] [From.Culture.GetName].
translation: [Root.GetTitledName]将新的习俗融入[Root.Culture.GetName]文化之中，不再认为[Root.GetHerselfHimself]是[From.Culture.GetName]人。

translation: 谈论有关[From.GetName]信仰的话题变得十分流行而广泛，因此[FromFrom.GetName]不得不被视为异端。
